results.title: Associate Copywriter
results.description:
Company Description

In short, The Prosper Group is a digital agency with purpose.

We are an internationally recognized, award-winning, full-service digital marketing agency specializing in online media, strategy, advertising, and fundraising for Republican political candidates, conservative advocacy organizations, associations, and non-profits. We leverage engaging design, innovative technology, and continual optimization to deliver demonstrable results for our clients.

The Prosper Group's best-in-industry work has been recognized for awards over 40 times by prestigious organizations such as the American Association of Political Consultants and Campaigns and Elections. We have worked in tandem with the Republican Governors Association, President Donald Trump, Vice President Mike Pence, Senator Ted Cruz, Governor Brian Kemp, the National Association of Manufacturers, Fox News, and many other candidates, associations, and non-profits.

The Prosper Group’s company culture is highly collaborative. We work together to deliver a positive experience for fellow employees as well as clients. We support each other and believe that personal growth is a beautiful journey (though sometimes hard!) that enables us to be the very best version of ourselves. Our team members love working hard and finding new and creative ways to amaze our clients. We are “always on” and ready to deliver.



Job Description

This position is a contract position, member of our fundraising team that focuses on preparing and producing content for clients ranging from members of the US House of Representatives to top Senatorial campaigns to PACs and Governors. In conjunction with their team, this person will participate in fundraising discussion for clients. Additionally, they will prepare written multi-media content that can include video scripts, email, SMS, social media, and more. All content will have a fundraising focus. 

 



Qualifications

 

  • Drafting email copy for use in fundraising solicitations for a political campaigns and non-profits. 
  • Collaborating with a Senior Director for Fundraising, accounts team members, and our fundraising coordinators to help develop fundraising plans and prepare copy for various clients
  • Work with client’s communications and membership staff to modify copy based on performance and create a custom-tailored user experience.
  • Act as a regular editor for client content in multiple mediums to ensure its flawless nature.

Qualifications

  • 3+  year of experience in marketing emails
  • 9am - 6pm ET
  • Bachelors Degree
  • Team oriented mindset
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office
  • Preferred: Knowledge of US based holidays and politics


Additional Information

Compensation will be commensurate with experience and qualifications.

 Non-disclosure and non-compete agreements may apply.

 

Please include the following:

  • Cover letter
  • Resume

results.title: Governance, Risk, and Compliance - Senior Analyst
results.description:

Governance, Risk, and Compliance - Senior Analyst

London, UK is preferred. Open to other locations within the UK.

As a Senior Analyst, you will work as part of a team of problem solvers with extensive finance management consulting experience. You will help finance and accounting executives at multi-billion-dollar companies solve complex problems, from strategy through execution. This role is fundamental in delivering world-class results for our portfolio of Fortune 500 and Fortune 1,000 clients.

At Clearsulting we firmly believe in our culture and follow our five Core Values: GRIT., Growth Mindset, Joy, Accountability, and Teamwork. We have been nationally recognized for our culture, firm leadership, and innovation, and we are honoured to have received the following awards and recognition:

Awards & Recognition:

results.title: Junior Designer
results.description:
Location: Europe, remote

This is a freelance position requiring roughly 20 hours per week, with the potential to develop into a full-time in-house position.

 

Who is Vev?

We’re a Norwegian design-tech startup working to make the web a more beautiful place. Our web creation platform is already helping professionals publish their wildest ideas on the web with complete creative and technical freedom. With ambitious growth goals, we’re now looking for a talented Junior Designer.

 

About the role

As a Junior Designer, you will be a visual thinker who can help us solve problems with hands-on skills and creative problem solving. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of graphic design principles and design thinking. Reporting to the Creative Director, you will work as part of the in-house creative team to create engaging designs according to requirements. In this role, you should be highly creative and have a sharp eye for details. If you’re passionate about design and eager to learn more, we’d like to meet you.

What you’ll be doing
  • Create impactful designs that capture and promote the Vev vision
  • Understand project requirements and concepts
  • Understand and follow the requirements of Vev’s brand identity
  • Create dynamic and engaging websites and various landing pages in Vev
  • Use various techniques to produce drafts, prototypes and engaging design solutions
  • Listen to feedback to hone skills and improve design
  • Collaborate with other designers and team members to launch projects and ensure high-quality work

Requirements

 
  • 1-3 years of experience in the creative industry, or equivalent
  • BFA/BA in Design or a related field
  • Experience with design software (i.e. Adobe CC, Figma)
  • Familiarity with design techniques and a strong understanding of visual elements and design principles
  • Teamwork and communication skills
  • A keen eye for detail
  • Time management and multitasking abilities
  • Critical thinker with creativity skills and problem-solving aptitude
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth business environment
  • Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work independently
  • Fluent English speaker

 

Ideally, you’ll also have:

  • Familiarity with web design space, HTML, and CSS
  • Good understanding of web design principles
  • Experience with Vev or alternative website platforms
  • Familiarity with video editing or motion graphics

FAQ

Our Hiring Process

  • Application review
  • A short portfolio review with our Creative Director
  • An Interview with our Creative Director
  • An Interview with one of our VPs / co-founder

Benefits

  • We value a good work-life balance, so working hours are flexible (core hours for meetings are 10.00 to 15.00).
  • A diverse team with a remote work culture (17 different nationalities on the team)

results.title: AWS Cloud Architect
results.description:
Nimbus is looking for a seasoned AWS Certified Cloud Architect to augment our technical team that serves the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) and supports AWS Cloud Migration. In this position, you will identify best practices and document them for the ADOs, AWS Asset tagging, Naming, Terraform modules, templates, guidance documents, and Support IaaC architecture implementations.

Specifically:

We are looking for a Technical Architect with AWS experience to provide technical support in developing and demonstrating practices and procedures that would promote the reuse of the Enterprise resources. The candidate will provide expertise for tasks such as the following:

Define and support CMS in implementing changes to how CMS applications are developed and architected as cloud-based applications.


- Conduct architecture analysis and provide solutions that:
- Optimize CMS cloud applications or provide re-engineering recommendations for the cloud environment
- Provide and support cloud computing application framework to serve as CMS cloud application standards for other system integrators to leverage.

- Assess transitions to ensure continued operational capability and capacity is maintained and supported

- Align with CMS technical architectures

- AWS Cost optimization strategies, tactics, and implementation
- Platform as a Service (PaaS)/Identity Federation (Single Sign On)
- Best practices for running serverless architecture

Requirements

Technical expertise on AWS and its offered services (Lambda, Athena, EC2, S3, Asset tagging, Naming, templatization to name a few)

 

Benefits

Great company with top-of-the-line benefits and the opportunity to work directly with CMS Sr Technical Leaders

  • Best-in-class compensation packages and employee benefits – many of them fully funded by Nimbus
  • Nimbus offers three different HSA-compatible Healthcare Plans at Bronze, Silver, and Gold Levels, contributing majority of employees' and their families' premiums.
  • Fully funded Dental PPO and Vision Plans.
  • Employees can enroll in a 401(k) plan, and Nimbus contributes 3% of the employee's salary to the plan.
  • Employees get paid holidays and generous Paid Time Off (PTO) from work for various needs.
  • Fully funded Short term and Long term disability coverage
  • Fully funded Term Life Insurance coverage
  • Employees are eligible for Performance-based bonuses.
  • Tuition assistance for completion of degrees, diplomas, and certificate courses.
  • Variety of other fringe benefits.
  • Fully funded “Stay Fit” program that pays for Gym memberships and fitness essentials.

results.title: Quality Assurance Lead
results.description:
Norima, a Winnipeg-based technology consulting company that prides itself on its ability to deliver results in the most complex and challenging business environments, is in need of an experienced Quality Assurance Analyst Lead with functional and technical expertise to lead one of our key delivery teams.

*This role will be remote*

Job Description

We are looking for candidates with exemplary character, consistency and competence to join a growing team of professionals who share a passion for solving complex problems with technology-based solutions. Ideally you have:

  • Completed a university degree or college diploma
  • A minimum of five (5) to eight (8) years of proven work experience in software testing
  • Experience leading a team in test planning delivery, preparation and activities relating to execution
  • Experience designing and executing clear and effective test plans ensuring for accuracy and completeness against business requirements
  • Experience working with developers to troubleshoot and resolve defects
  • Experience writing test scripts to test applications against underlying data or third-party systems/tools
  • Impeccable attention to detail
  • Exceptional communication and problem-solving skills
  • Knowledge and experience in the ISTQB body of knowledge

Overall Qualifications

Norima is a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company, looking to hire the best, brightest, and hardest working consultants onto our high-calibre team. As the ideal candidate, you:

  • Are client delivery focused, and committed to working as a flexible extension to our clients to earn a place as their trusted advisor
  • Possess superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Have a natural curiosity towards gaining new understanding and broadening your knowledge base
  • Are skilled in managing and prioritizing multiple projects and competing deadlines
  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Additional Technical Requirements

  • Execute manual and technical test strategies, plans and procedures
  • Document results to ensure all applications developed meet quality standards
  • Analyze, design, and develop manual and technical test strategies, plans and procedures
  • Document and investigate software problems, and liaise with software developers to solve problems
  • Ability to provide guidance to others regarding testing best practices
  • Experience using testing tools, such as JIRA, Rally, Quality Centre, etc.
  • Experience with automated testing tools an asset, such as Soap UI or Selenium
  • Experience in agile and waterfall testing environments
  • Knowledge of SQL or database testing an asset.

Why Norima?

For over 10 years, Norima Consulting Inc. has been transforming businesses by leveraging the right technology, at the right time, by, and in collaboration with, the right people. Norima has been consistently growing in both size and revenue for over a decade, almost exclusively by word of mouth, and this has only been possible by ensuring that we have been an employer of choice for top professionals who are passionate about demonstrating real results and committed to achieving excellence.

Norima works hard to provide a collaborative, rewarding environment and work opportunities that attract and retain top candidates and employees. Norima's Learning and Growth strategy is to actively invest in professional development and to provide opportunity for progressive work assignments to build experience. Norima is a place where professional growth is actively supported and expected.

According to independent employee reviews on Glassdoor.com, 100% would recommend Norima to a friend, and 100% approve of the CEO. Norima has a summary score of 4.9 stars out of 5.0.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits, an RRSP matching program, a professional development program, and a positive work environment. This is a great opportunity to be at the heart of a growing company.

results.title: IOS Developer
results.description:
We are looking for an iOS developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a range of iOS devices including mobile phones and tablet computers. Your primary focus will be development of iOS applications and their integration with back-end services. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.

About the company:

Gozem is Africa's transportation application. Launched in Lome, Togo, Gozem aims to make transportation across West and Central Africa easier, safer and more reliable.

Through our Mobile Application, users can easily find transportation providers that will pick them up within minutes and will soon be able to get food delivered, and transact with a wide network or merchants.

Do you aspire to flourish in a stimulating and friendly environment? Do you want to evolve and progress in digital, dynamic and disruptive contexts?

Help us grow and become Africa's next unicorn! Join a company where long-term vision, ambition and human values ​​will be the connectors of your professional project!

Job Description:

To ensure success as an iOS Developer, you should have a strong working knowledge of iOS Frameworks, be proficient in Objective-C, and be able to work as part of a team. Ultimately, an outstanding iOS Developer should be able to create functional, attractive applications that perfectly meet the needs of the user.

Main duties:

  • Design and build applications for the iOS platform
  • Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
  • Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization

Profile:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer programming, computer science, or a related field.
  • Proficient with Objective-C or Swift , and Cocoa Touch
  • Experience with iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, etc.
  • Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services
  • Knowledge of other web technologies and UI/UX standards
  • Understanding of Apple's design principles and interface guidelines
  • Knowledge of low-level C-based libraries is preferred
  • Experience with performance and memory tuning with tools 
  • Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
  • Knack for benchmarking and optimization
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git
  • Familiarity with continuous integration

***************************************************************************************************************************************************************************

Gozem est une plateforme technologique de transport pour l'Afrique de l'Ouest francophone. Une application mobile de mise en relation d'utilisateurs avec des professionnels du transport urbain. Lancé au Togo et au Bénin. Gozem ambitionne à être la prochaine licorne de l'Afrique de l'ouest. La société lancera ses services  au Cameroun au Gabon ainsi que plusieurs autres pays en Afrique .

Vous aspirez à vous épanouir dans un environnement stimulant et convivial ? Vous êtes passionné(e) par les domaines de l'Informatique et du Digital ? Vous avez envie d'évoluer et de progresser dans des contextes applicatifs et d'infrastructures dynamiques à forte ampleur.

Rejoignez une entreprise où la vision à long terme, l'ambition et les valeurs humaines seront les connecteurs de votre projet professionnel !

Dans la continuité de son développement, Gozem recherche un Développeur IOS

Ce que vous allez faire

  • Concevoir et créer des applications pour la plate-forme iOS
  • Assurer la performance, la qualité et la réactivité des applications
  • Collaborer avec une équipe pour définir, concevoir et expédier de nouvelles fonctionnalités
  • Identifier et corriger les goulots d'étranglement et corriger les bugs
  • Aider à maintenir la qualité du code, la documentation, l'organisation et l'automatisation

Ce dont vous avez besoin

  • Maîtrise des langues (français et anglais)
  • La compétence avec Objective-C / Swift et Cocoa Touch
  • Une expérience avec les infrastructures iOS telles que Core Data, Core Animation, etc.
  • Une maitrise du stockage hors connexion, le threading et le réglage des performances
  • Familiarité avec les API RESTful pour connecter des applications iOS à des services back-end
  • Une connaissance d'autres technologies Web et des normes UI / UX
  • Une bonne compréhension des principes de conception et des directives d'interface d'Apple
  • Une connaissance des bibliothèques de bas niveau basées sur C est préférable
  • Une expérience avec les performances et le réglage de la mémoire
  • Familiarité avec les API de message en Cloud et les notifications push
  • talent pour l'analyse comparative et l'optimisation
  • Une bonne compréhension des outils de gestion de version de code tels que Git

results.title: Director of Product Marketing
results.description:
At Nova Credit, our mission is to power a more fair and inclusive financial system for the world. Nova Credit’s diverse global team is stitching together the world's credit data into a single network to unlock financial opportunities for immigrants and other populations historically excluded from the credit system. We’ve built a platform that enables lenders to access a single, predictive cross-border credit database to help enable underwriting decisions. We are backed by leading investors including Kleiner Perkins, General Catalyst, and Index Ventures.
 
Nova Credit works with some of the world’s preeminent firms in the credit sector. Our unique product position generates value for a diverse set of constituents, including thousands of consumers, public corporations, and various financial & technology partners globally. This privileged position creates a unique opportunity for marketing to generate significant growth opportunities through a variety of strategies by working closely with leaders across various organizations. 
 
We’re looking for a Director of Product Marketing to elevate our brand and product position into a sophisticated, enterprise-grade offering to enable our GTM function to enter hyper-growth. In this role you will fully own the strategy and execution of the entire product marketing function, focusing on building a cohesive B2B narrative for our two (and future) products, solidifying our position as leaders in our product categories, developing exceptional thought leadership, and enabling our sales and marketing campaigns with content that moves our target consumer. At the same time, you will oversee the product marketing strategy for our D2C motion, as we continue to grow our affiliate revenue and expand our existing accounts under the same Nova Credit brand.
 
This is a full-time role on the Marketing Team, reporting directly to Nova Credit’s VP of Marketing.



RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Elevate Nova Credit’s brand and product assets to position the company as a leading, enterprise-grade financial technology provider
  • Provide strategic direction for our product marketing function as well as create a cross-functional view of marketing initiatives and campaigns
  • Maintain strong cross-functional relationships and work streams with Product, Revenue, and Engineering to execute product assets and campaigns 
  • Build exceptional thought leadership content that (1) educates our prospects/customers, (2) positions Nova Credit at the forefront of the cash flow underwriting movement, and (3) solidifies our expertise in the new-to-country credit market 
  • Own and maintain our portfolio of marketing assets, including website, landing pages, sales collateral (below), videos, and more
  • Create collateral that helps our sales team win deals, including pitch decks, one-pagers, proposal documents, use cases, case studies, email copy, and other educational materials 
  • Develop a robust framework for maintaining and democratizing product messaging and collateral 
  • Leverage product and industry expertise (via customer feedback, user research, GTM market analysis, etc.) to continuously drive customers’ product competency and usage
  • Understand our customers’ needs at a granular level, unearthing the most critical pain points, and be their voice throughout all marketing assets and campaigns
  • Lead product launches and strategic marketing efforts 
  • Routinely measure the success of assets and leverage insights to influence future GTM roadmaps 



YOUR SKILLSET:
  • Proven experience working with senior leads in a cross-functional capacity to drive projects to completion with a high degree of excellence
  • Experience building product marketing teams and managing various skill sets such as creative, content development, writing, editorial, product management, and design
  • Vision and creativity for impactful storytelling 
  • Comfortable working with B2B and D2C audiences, simultaneously
  • Strong project management skills; results-focused with impactful execution and follow-through; highly detail-oriented
  • Ability to translate highly technical B2B products into crisp customer-facing narratives with a focus on driving product education and usage 
  • Experience working with early-stage technology companies selling to different customer profiles; ideally in a fast-paced environment; fintech experience preferred
  • 8+ years of B2B product marketing experience
 
We consider all elements of compensation as a part of the value we provide to Novans. This may include base salary, equity grants, incentive compensation for eligible roles, professional development, flexible PTO, and tenure rewards. We offer U.S.-based Novans competitive, employer-subsidized medical, dental, and vision plans, in addition to mental health and wellness benefits and a range of other benefits & perks.
 
Base Salary Range for U.S.-based candidates: $175,000 - $213,000, dependent on the candidate’s individual experience, skills, education, location, and qualifications. 
 
Everyone is welcome at Nova Credit. We are an equal-opportunity employer where our diversity and inclusion are central pillars to our company strategy. We look for applicants who understand, embrace and thrive in a multicultural and increasingly globalized world. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Customer Success Manager
results.description:
*This job is remote-friendly for all candidates currently authorized to work in the United States or Canada.

We are Battlefy, and we power Esports.

We are looking for a Customer Success Manager, ideally with a background in digital agency, to help us build the future of Esports. Battlefy's platform is the gold standard in the competitive esports industry and we need smart, customer-obsessed people to help deliver world-class experiences for our clients, drive engagement with the Battlefy platform, and own organic customer growth.

The Customer Success Manager will be responsible for supporting key clients, including nearly all of the biggest game publishers in the industry. We work with incredible organizations like Riot Games, EA, Red Bull, the NFL, NBA, NHL, and Major League Baseball. The biggest brands in the world deliver their global esports strategies on our platform.

Successful candidates for this role will excel at the following:

Account Management

  • Working with enterprise customers to launch, grow, and iterate on esports experiences;
  • Owning of post-launch retention, growth, and iteration tasks with key customers;
  • Nurturing client relationships, acting as the voice of the customer;
  • Making trade-off decisions in order to handle requirements changes;
  • Acting as a key internal stakeholder with sales, product, marketing, and other internal teams.

Communication

  • Unsurpassed communications with customers, project teams, and others;
  • Collaborating with different business units to find the right balance of commitments.

Detail Oriented

  • Delivering on all assigned KPIs and keeping up with all reporting tasks;
  • Bringing a high level of attention to detail regarding campaign execution.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience as an account manager, project manager, or customer success rep in a digital agency environment;
  • Bachelors degree or professional experience equivalent;
  • Strong technical acumen with fluency in modern digital tools for project management, communication, tracking, etc.
  • Strong communication skills.

Benefits

At Battlefy, you will be instrumental in helping the team to rise up and become legends. While doing so, you will receive a competitive salary, flexible hours, programs to support outdoor fitness activities, and flexible vacation time. Most importantly, you will receive the support of a talented, warm, and welcoming family that shares your passion and enthusiasm for building a legacy.
